rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures AI agent/public ChatBot only gives safe, public info to unauthenticated/guest users.
rules.compact_rule: If mode=public: only access data in [company_name, mission, values, high-level services, locations, public stories, anonymized case studies, approximate headcount]; deny or redact all sensitive/internal info; respond Outcome=denied_security for disallowed queries.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Public ChatBot must mention new ownership for transparency; merger disclosure requirement.
rules.compact_rule: Public ChatBot responses must mention 'AI Excellence Group INTERNATIONAL' in all company overviews or context-setting answers.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Restricts AI agent to lowest permissions when user is unknown; prevents data leaks.
rules.compact_rule: If Req_WhoAmI returns no CurrentUser, agent defaults to public-only, read-only, whitelisted info. Never attempt internal data access or modification in public mode.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Role-based access: strict scoping of read/write authority by user level (executive, lead, core, guest).
rules.compact_rule: Access to data: 1/ Executives: read all, limited write (sensitivities checked); 2/ Leads: read all in city/scope, write in owned/assigned resources; 3/ Core: read only projects/customers involved with, write on own records; 4/ Guests/public: public info only.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Granular, default-deny permissions to sensitive and highly sensitive data; ensures legal/data privacy.
rules.compact_rule: Default: All sensitive (salaries, health, internal notes, detailed system info, time entries) and highly sensitive (keys/credentials, legal docs) data are denied except for explicitly authorized users and only for lowest necessary scope.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents privileged escalation/emergency use of agent as 'root' or unrestricted superuser.
rules.compact_rule: AI agent NEVER acts as root user; always acts either as: (a) authenticated employee (with correct level/scope); or (b) public mode (minimal permissions).

rules.why_relevant_summary: Mandates agent checks who it's acting for before any non-public API/data access.
rules.compact_rule: Before any non-public operation, agent must call Req_WhoAmI; if context/identity missing, deny/moderate request.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Forbids irreversible, destructive, or noncompliant data deletions by agent.
rules.compact_rule: Agent must never delete employee, customer, or project records, or execute 'wipe personal data' actions, without explicit executive approval; must deny or escalate such requests (Outcome=denied_security).

rules.why_relevant_summary: For changes with compliance/audit risk, requires traceability (JIRA ticket) and, for critical changes, multi-party approval.
rules.compact_rule: All changes to core customer/project/company data, dependency mappings: require linked JIRA ticket; high-impact changes additionally require sign-off from executive or ops approver. Deny if traceability/approval missing.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents read/write access outside user's assigned responsibility, project, or city/leadership scope.
rules.compact_rule: For non-executives, allow access only to resources in user's projects, assigned customers, or city-based domain (Leads); deny 'curiosity' browsing and cross-resource data viewing outside scope.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Sensitive data access (such as salaries, workload risk, detailed customer/system notes) is strictly need-to-know.
rules.compact_rule: Sensitive data (salaries, health, workload info, customer system diagrams) accessible only to (a) Executives, (b) Ops (for sanctioned ops/HR, time tracking), or (c) directly involved leads. Never reveal to public, core team, or others.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Agent must enforce least-privilege on all data exports, disables bulk and ad-hoc exports in transition phase.
rules.compact_rule: During merger transition/lockdown: data exports (customer lists, project logs, registry) require JIRA ticket & explicit executive/Ops approval; ad-hoc or bulk exports disabled for standard users.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures all API-based actions (by agent) are small, targeted; discourages batch/bulk/destructive acts.
rules.compact_rule: Agent prefers read and small, reversible changes; bulk modifications, mass deletes/writes, and irreversible actions are forbidden unless specifically permitted by high-level approval.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Standardizes all agent responses for audit/logging/UI and checks outcome/security on every reply.
rules.compact_rule: All agent replies use Req_ProvideAgentResponse (single response per action), and outcome must reflect result: ok_answer, ok_not_found, denied_security, none_clarification_needed, none_unsupported, or error_internal; link all referenced/concrete entities when allowed, never invent IDs.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Distinguishes guests/public (minimally privileged) from authenticated users (employee, exec, etc) at all times.
rules.compact_rule: All agent operations gated by user role: if unauthenticated/guest, treat as applies_to_guests and restrict to public-mode rules only.
